Package project.restaurant.repository

Interface OrdersRepository

All Superinterfaces:
org.springframework.data.repository.CrudRepository<Orders,Integer>, org.springframework.data.jpa.repository.JpaRepository<Orders,Integer>, org.springframework.data.repository.ListCrudRepository<Orders,Integer>, org.springframework.data.repository.ListPagingAndSortingRepository<Orders,Integer>, org.springframework.data.repository.PagingAndSortingRepository<Orders,Integer>, org.springframework.data.repository.query.QueryByExampleExecutor<Orders>, org.springframework.data.repository.Repository<Orders,Integer>
@Repository public interface OrdersRepository extends org.springframework.data.jpa.repository.JpaRepository<Orders,Integer>
JpaRepository is a collection of APIs used for basic operations and sorting, and OrdersRepository extends this collection to modify 'Orders' table.
Author:
Tanmeet, Peter, Irmani, Faraz, James, Wen, Pengyuan(Kenny), Daniel, Bailey

  • Method Details

    • findByState

      @Query("SELECT o FROM Orders o WHERE o.state = \'not confirmed\'") List<Orders> findByState()
      selects all items from Orders where the order is not confirmed.
      Returns:
      a list of not confirmed orders.

    • findByState

      @Query("SELECT o FROM Orders o WHERE o.state != ?1") List<Orders> findByState(String state)
      selects all items from Orders where state is the given parameter.
      Parameters:
      state - an object of type String.
      Returns:
      a list of Orders that satisfy the query.

    • findOrderByWaiterId

      @Query(value="select * from orders where waiterid=:id and state != \'delivered\'", nativeQuery=true) List<Orders> findOrderByWaiterId(int id)
      selects all items from orders where id is the given parameter.
      Parameters:
      id - an object of type int.
      Returns:
      a list of orders that satisfy the query.

    • findByuID

      @Query("SELECT o FROM Orders o WHERE o.userid = ?1") List<Orders> findByuID(Optional<Users> user)
      selects all items from Orders where user is the given parameter.
      Parameters:
      user - an object of type optional users.
      Returns:
      a list of Orders that satisfy the query.

    • findConfirmedStateAsC

      @Query("SELECT o FROM Orders o WHERE o.state = \'Confirmed\' Order by o.timeplaced ASC") List<Orders> findConfirmedStateAsC()
      get all orders in confirmed state from database.
      Returns:
      returns a list of confirmed state orders in ascending order.

    • findCookingStateAsC

      @Query("SELECT o FROM Orders o WHERE o.state = \'Cooking\' Order by o.timeplaced ASC") List<Orders> findCookingStateAsC()
      get all orders in cooking state from database.
      Returns:
      returns a list of cooking state orders in ascending order.

    • findReadyStateAsC

      @Query("SELECT o FROM Orders o WHERE o.state = \'Ready\' Order by o.timeplaced ASC") List<Orders> findReadyStateAsC()
      get all orders in ready state from database.
      Returns:
      returns a list of ready state orders in ascending order.

    • findCookingStateByKitchenStaffIdAsC

      @Query("SELECT o FROM Orders o WHERE o.state = \'Cooking\' and o.kitchenstaffid = ?1 Order by o.timeplaced ASC") List<Orders> findCookingStateByKitchenStaffIdAsC(KitchenStaff kstaff)
      get orders in cooking state from database according to the kitchenstaff.
      Parameters:
      kstaff - is the kitchenstaff we according to.
      Returns:
      returns a list of cooking state orders in ascending order.

    • findOrderByOrderId

      @Query(value="select * from orders where orderid=:input", nativeQuery=true) Orders findOrderByOrderId(Integer input)
      selects all items from orders where input is the given parameter.
      Parameters:
      input - an object of type Integer.
      Returns:
      an order satisfying the query.

    • findByOrderId

      @Query("SELECT o FROM Orders o WHERE o.orderid = ?1") List<Orders> findByOrderId(Integer orderId)
      selects all items from orders where orderId is the given parameter.
      Parameters:
      orderId - an object of type Integer.
      Returns:
      returns a list of orders that satisfy the query.

    • findbyStateAndID

      @Query("SELECT o FROM Orders o WHERE o.state != ?1 AND o.userid = ?2") List<Orders> findbyStateAndID(String state, Users user)
      selects all items from orders where state and user are the given parameters.
      Parameters:
      state - an object of type String.
      user - an object of type Users.
      Returns:
      a list of orders that satisfy the query.

    • findNotComfirmedAndComfirmedOrdersByUserId

      @Query("SELECT o FROM Orders o WHERE o.state = \'confirmed\' OR o.state = \'not confirmed\' AND o.userid=?1") List<Orders> findNotComfirmedAndComfirmedOrdersByUserId(Users userid)
      get orders in confirmed or not confirmed state from database according to the user.
      Parameters:
      userid - is the user we according to.
      Returns:
      returns a list of orders in confirmed or not confirmed state in ascending order.

    • findCancelStateOrderState

      @Query("SELECT o FROM Orders o WHERE o.state = \'cancelled\'") List<Orders> findCancelStateOrderState()
      get orders in cancelled state from database.
      Returns:
      returns a list of orders in cancelled state.

    • findOrderInCancelingStateByWaiterId

      @Query("SELECT o FROM Orders o WHERE o.state = \'canceling\' AND o.waiterid=?1") List<Orders> findOrderInCancelingStateByWaiterId(Waiters waiterid)
      get orders in canceling state from database according to the waiter.
      Parameters:
      waiterid - is the waiter we according to.
      Returns:
      returns a list of canceling state orders.

    • findbyEqualState

      @Query("SELECT o FROM Orders o WHERE o.state = ?1 AND o.userid = ?2") List<Orders> findbyEqualState(String state, Users user)
      selects all orders where the state is equal to that specific user.
      Parameters:
      state - the state the order is in processing
      user - the user that placed the order

    • findByPayState

      @Query("SELECT o FROM Orders o WHERE o.paystate = \'?1\'") List<Orders> findByPayState(String paystate)
      selects all items from Orders where the payment state matches the parameter.
      Parameters:
      paystate - state an object of type String.
      Returns:
      a list of orders with the given payment state.

    • findByPayState

      @Query("SELECT o FROM Orders o WHERE o.paystate = \'unpaid\'") List<Orders> findByPayState()
      selects all items from Orders where the customer is waiting to pay.
      Returns:
      a list of orders where payment state is 'waitingtopay'.
